twoFactorAuth.title: Two-Factor Authentication

status.enabledDescription: Your account is protected with an additional layer of security.
status.disabledDescription: Add an extra layer of security to your account.

whatIs.title: What is Two-Factor Authentication?
whatIs.description: Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) adds an extra layer of security to your account by requiring a time-based code from your phone in addition to your password.
whatIs.benefit1: Protects your account even if your password is compromised
whatIs.benefit2: Uses industry-standard TOTP (Time-based One-Time Password) algorithm
whatIs.benefit3: Works with popular authenticator apps like Google Authenticator, Authy, or Microsoft Authenticator

twoFactorAuth.scanQRCode: Scan this QR code with your authenticator app

manualSetup.title: Manual Setup
manualSetup.instructions: Enter this secret key in your authenticator app:

twoFactorAuth.saveSecretWarning: Save this secret key in a safe place. You'll need it to recover access to your account if you lose your authenticator device.

enableSuccess.title: Two-Factor Authentication Enabled!
enableSuccess.subtitle: Your account is now protected with 2FA.
enableSuccess.verifiedDescription: Your authenticator app has been successfully configured and two-factor authentication is now active on your account.

verification.title: Verify Your Authenticator
verification.subtitle: Scan the QR code or enter the secret key in your authenticator app, then enter the 6-digit code to verify.

enableModal.title: Enable Two-Factor Authentication
enableModal.warningDescription: Please enter your account password to enable two-factor authentication.

disableModal.title: Disable Two-Factor Authentication
disableModal.warningDescription: Disabling 2FA will make your account less secure. You'll need to enter your current password and a valid 2FA code to proceed.
